meanings.definition: Cause (a train or tram) to leave its tracks accidentally.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain caused the train to derail.
meanings.sent2: If the tracks are not maintained, a train can derail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to derail the toy train by placing obstacles on the tracks.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden outburst of laughter derailed the serious discussion.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news completely derailed his plans for the day.

meanings.definition: Prevent (a process or plan) from succeeding.
meanings.sent1: Don't let small obstacles derail your progress.
meanings.sent2: Lack of funding can derail a project.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook without a recipe can easily derail your dinner plans.
meanings.sent4: A sudden power outage derailed the presentation at the meeting.
meanings.sent5: Her determination to succeed cannot be derailed by minor setbacks.
